description: From Middle English uncouple; equivalent to un- +â€Ž couple.

verbs.description: uncouple (third-person singular simple present uncouples, present participle uncoupling, simple past and past participle uncoupled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To disconnect or detach one thing from another.
examples: We uncoupled the trailer and left it behind.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To loose, as dogs, from their couples.
